location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to John Wedderburn, Accountant General, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of John Wedderburn's letter of 8 October 1821. He transmits a copy of the annual cash account (not included), explaining that this copy contains corrections to various errors that were present in the first version that was sent. In addition, Dow forwards the second of exchange (not included) of the different sets of bills relating to the military and marine disbursements, which have also been previously transmitted. Dow states that the quarterly accounts are now in progress and that he will do his utmost to have them finished by the end of the month.
